moves.2... d6 3. Nc3 Bg4 4. h3: Does keep the pin? Or does he swap off? I would like to know your opinion.
moves.5. g4 Bg6 6. h4: I decide to chase him even further. It is clear tthat he doesn't want to go down a piece early.
moves.6... h5 7. Bh3: I like the look of this diagonal. I also think it may be a good idea to cover my king side after I have opened it up so much.
moves.7... Nc6 8. d3 Nf6 9. g5: I get on the front foot and try to put some pressure on.
moves.9... Nd7 10. Be3: I get my pieces out of the way so I can castle queen side. There is obviously no chance for me to safely castle king side.
moves.12... Nd4: Why would he do that? I was curious when he played it.
moves.13. Nxd4 exd4 14. Bxd4 c5: He may have sacrificed the pawn to get his queen out and about to attack my reasonably well-defended king.
moves.15. Be3 Ne5 16. f4: Looks like there is going to be a big push on the king side.
moves.16... Nc6 17. f5 Bh7 18. Rhf1: This could get ugly for black.
moves.18... Qb6 19. Qxh5 g6: What do you think he should have done??? And do I have a better option than to swap?
moves.20. fxg6 Bxg6 21. Qh6: I've got him right where I want him.
moves.21... Nb4 22. h5 Bh7 23. g6: The rooks will be swapped off now.
moves.23... fxg6 24. Rxf8+ Rxf8 25. hxg6: Here is the killer. What should black do? And should he have taken back with the bishop?
moves.25... Rf6 26. Qxh7+ Kf8 27. Bh6+: Time to get the bishop in on the action.
moves.27... Ke8 28. g7 Rxh6: This is as good as black resigning.
moves.30. g8=Q+: After this move black resigns. I have such a material advantage even if I play poorly from here, I'll win.
